from_cdata.p: Bill to require a person carrying out delivery services by motorcycle or moped to hold a full licence; to provide for penalties for an employer who employs a delivery rider who holds a provisional licence; and for connected purposes.

root.BusinessItemHeadingNumbered: Child Sexual Abuse Material (Digital Devices): Ten Minute Rule Motion

MotionText.from_cdata: That leave be given to bring in a Bill to provide for a power to require a person to grant access to their digital devices in the course of a lawful inspection under the Customs and Excise Management Act 1979 where there is a reasonable suspicion that the device may contain child sexual abuse material; to provide that refusal to grant such access constitutes an offence; and for connected purposes.

from_cdata.p: The Member moving and a Member opposing this Motion may each speak for up to 10 minutes.

p.style: margin: 2pt 0cm 6pt 12pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 13pt; font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif;

from_cdata.p: That the Order of 28 November 2023 (Criminal Justice Bill: Programme) be varied as follows:

p.style: margin: 2pt 0cm 6pt 12pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 18pt; line-height: 13pt; font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif;

from_cdata.p: (1) Paragraphs (4) and (5) of the Order shall be omitted.

p.style: margin: 2pt 0cm 6pt 12pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 18pt; line-height: 13pt; font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif;

from_cdata.p: (2) Proceedings on Consideration and Third Reading shall be taken in two days in accordance with the following provisions of this Order.

p.style: margin: 2pt 0cm 6pt 12pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 18pt; line-height: 13pt; font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif;

from_cdata.p: (3) Proceedings on Consideration—

p.style: margin: 2pt 0cm 6pt 72pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: -18pt; line-height: 13pt; font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif;

from_cdata.p: (a) shall be taken on each of those days in the order shown in the first column of the following Table, and

p.style: margin: 2pt 0cm 6pt 72pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: -18pt; line-height: 13pt; font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif;

from_cdata.p: (b) shall (so far as not previously concluded) be brought to a conclusion at the times specified in the second column of the Table.

p.style: margin: 0cm; text-align: center; line-height: 14pt; font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-weight: bold;
margin: 0cm; text-align: center; line-height: 14pt; font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-weight: bold; break-after: avoid;

from_cdata.p: TABLE

p.style: margin: 3pt 0cm 0cm 56pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 13pt; font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; text-indent: -28pt;
margin: 2pt 0cm 6pt 12pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 18pt; line-height: 13pt; font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif;

from_cdata.p: (4) Proceedings on Third Reading shall (so far as not previously concluded) be brought to a conclusion one hour after their commencement.

root.DebateTimingRubric: Up to six hours from the start of proceedings on the Criminal Justice Bill: Programme (No. 2) motion (if that motion is agreed to)

MotionText.from_cdata: As amended in Public Bill Committee, to be considered.

from_cdata.p: For amendments, see separate paper (also available on the publications webpage for the Bill).

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Lora, serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;

from_cdata.span: That, at this day’s sitting, Standing Order No. 41A (Deferred divisions) shall not apply to the Motion in the name of Secretary Alex Chalk relating to Legal Aid and Advice.

from_cdata.p: That the draft Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Act 2012 (Legal Aid: Domestic Abuse) (Amendment) Order 2024, which was laid before this House on 25 March, be approved.
That the draft Representation of the People (England and Wales and Northern Ireland) (Amendment) Regulations 2024, which were laid before this House on 15 April, be approved.
